greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, read by rows, that transforms rows into diagonals in the table of coefficients of successive iterations of x+x^2 (cf. A122888).
comment: Compare to the triangle A071207 that transforms rows into diagonals in the table of iterations of x/(1-x), where A071207(n,k) gives the number of labeled free trees with n vertices and k children of the root that have a label smaller than the label of the root. Does this triangle have a similar interpretation?
link: Paul D. Hanna, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..495 (rows 0..30)
example: Coefficients in self-compositions of (x+x^2) form table A122888:
This triangle T transforms rows of A122888 into diagonals of A122888;
program: (PARI) {T(n, k)=local(F=x, M, N, P, m=n); M=matrix(m+2, m+2, r, c, F=x;for(i=1, r+c-2, F=subst(F, x, x+x^2+x*O(x^(m+2)))); polcoeff(F, c)); N=matrix(m+1, m+1, r, c, F=x;for(i=1, r, F=subst(F, x, x+x^2+x*O(x^(m+2)))); polcoeff(F, c)); P=matrix(m+1, m+1, r, c, M[r+1, c]); (P~*N~^-1)[n+1, k+1]}
for(n=0, 10, for(k=0, n, print1(T(n, k), ", ")); print(""))
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Nov 27 2009
